item.name: 1861: Railways of the Russian Empire & 1867: Railways of Canada
1861: The Railways of the Russian Empire
221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game
Acquire
item.comment: So much better with the "open stock" rule. Otherwise it's a memory game.

item.name: Age of Steam
item.comment: Wow. An utterly amazing game, complete with tough choices, a myriad of options, and the need for both short-term and long-term planning. Highly recommended if you're looking for an engrossing, medium-to-heavy game.

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion #1: England & Ireland
Age of Steam Expansion #2: Western United States and Germany
Age of Steam Expansion #3: Scandinavia and Korea
Age of Steam Expansion: Holland / Madagascar
Alexandros
item.comment: Felt somewhat dry. Didn't really suck me in. I initially thought it was going to be a deeper game than it was. Turned out to be a bit short and shallow for my taste.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: I like this game more and more each time I play it. With a group of experienced players, it can be extremely tense and excited, with lots of room for deep strategy. The sacrifice provides a delicious tension.

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: Fun game- but player elimination can be a drag. Play fast and light for best results.
item.conditiontext: Also have Dodge City, High Noon, and a Fistful of Cards. Would be willing to trade all as a package, which would also include some mocked-up promo cards (Claus the Saint, etc...).

item.name: BANG! A Fistful of Cards
item.conditiontext: Also have the Bang! basic game, Dodge City, and High Noon. Would be willing to trade all as a package, which would also include a few mocked-up promo cards (Claus the Saint, etc...).

item.name: BANG! Dodge City
item.comment: Great expansion to a great game. Some very powerful cards!
item.conditiontext: Also have the Bang! basic game, High Noon, and a Fistful of Cards. Would be willing to trade all as a package, which would also include a few mocked-up promo cards (Claus the Saint, etc...).

item.name: BANG! High Noon
item.comment: Fun, chaotic expansion to a fun game. Be sure to print out the two extra cards from the Davinci games website.
item.conditiontext: Also have the Bang! base game, Dodge City, and a Fistful of Cards. Would be willing to trade all as a package, which would also include a few mocked-up promo cards (Claus the Saint, etc...).

item.name: Before I Kill You, Mister Spy...
Bohnanza
item.comment: Very easy to teach, even to non-gamers. Just get them past the "It's a bean-trading game!" and they should be okay. Great player interaction. The key to enjoyment (and success) in this game is to trade, trade, trade!

item.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Game
Carcassonne: King & Scout
item.comment: King adds a counting complexity to Carcassonne that is most unwelcome. Did not try Scout for Carc: H & G.

item.name: Catan Card Game
item.comment: A bore. Way too long and not nearly as exciting as it should be.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: A bit dry for my taste. Role selection is interesting, but game can drag or be slightly boring.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Fairy Tale
item.comment: Fun, light set-collecting game. The art is excellent.

item.name: Falling
item.comment: Bizarre real-time card game. If the theme appeals to you, you might enjoy it as a filler. Very fast play.

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: Quick random fun, when you're looking for something utterly mindless.

item.name: The Great Dalmuti
item.comment: Fun card climbing game. Great light party game or something quick to play with a large group.

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment: Great game to introduce non-gamers to.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
IceTowers
item.comment: Fun, quick and light filler game for Icehouse pieces. It's like Icehouse-super-light.

item.name: Ikusa
item.comment: Fun game, but it takes so long to play, I could fit 5 or 6 other games in the same space.

item.name: Illuminati
item.comment: Enjoyable. Bash the leader until people run out of money. Then the next person wins.

item.name: Kill Doctor Lucky
item.conditiontext: Great condition. All cards included. "Director's Cut" version with game designer "commentary" and alternate board on back.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: You'd better find the humor funny, 'cause there isn't much else to this game. Very random, pointless, agonizing.

item.name: King of New York: Power Up!
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
Die Macher
item.comment:
Valley Games, 3rd edition. Everything is in fantastic condition. Played a few times, but plenty of score sheets remaining on the pad. Tons of various player aids printed out from BGG.
In this edition, the "economic development" and "nuclear power" cards look incredibly similar to each other, especially across the table. To rectify this, I put tiny yellow sticker dots on all the "nuclear power" cards, making the game much more playable. They can easily be removed if you wish, or colored in with a little radiation symbol (my original intention), or used just fine as is.
Comes from a smoke-free, pet-free home.

item.name: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
Playing With Pyramids
item.comment: Great series of games for Icehouse pieces.

item.name: Polarity
item.comment: Tremendous fun game of skill and dexterity. Can be quite tense!

item.name: Power Grid: The New Power Plants – Set 1
Reef Encounter
item.comment: This game just doesn't do it for me. I find it very dry, and my options not as necessarily interesting as it would first appear, on a turn-by-turn basis. Played both live and by web, liking it less each time I play.
item.conditiontext: Brand new and sealed. Z-Man games edition.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Samurai
item.comment: A great game that is short but surprisingly deep. More random with more players. Not the most intricate Knizia tile-laying game, but has one of my favorite scoring mechanisms. Very elegant.

item.name: San Juan
item.comment: Puerto Rico light! Easier to teach, works as great stepping-stone into PR. Fun and quick.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: I feel like this is simply a card game, where either the game plays you rather than you playing the game, or you have to follow a pre-scripted strategy. You really have to be into the role-playing aspect to enjoy this one.

item.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: Jack the Ripper & West End Adventures
Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases
Star Wars: Episode 1 – Clash of the Lightsabers
Survive!
item.haspartslist: Have extra pieces: 2 sea serpents, 1 whale, and 1 shark from the 1982 Parker Bros. version.

item.name: Take 5!
item.comment: Quick, light filler game.

item.name: The Cities and Knights of Catan
The Cities and Knights of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
The Seafarers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
The Settlers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Brilliant and simple game that can appeal to gamers and non-gamers alike. Best way to introduce people to the hobby since The Settlers of Catan.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 – India & Switzerland
Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
Tier auf Tier: Das große Abenteuer
Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: Brilliantly strategic and so very tense to play. An absolute masterpiece.

item.name: Tongiaki: Journey into the Unknown
item.comment: Very chaotic and random. An okay filler game.

item.name: Torres
item.comment: Simple to learn, but damn fun. I like this game more and more each time I play.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: GMT Games, includes revised cards. Like new condition, played once. Comes from a smoke-free, pet-free home.

item.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Classic Movie Monsters
item.comment: Bézier Games, English/German second edition (2010 reprint w/ character descriptions and Classic Movie Monsters). Like new condition, never played. Includes: Ultimate Werewolf: Classic Movie Monsters in the box. Comes from a smoke-free, pet-free home.

item.name: Wallenstein
item.comment: An excellent and fun strategic game. Mere words cannot describe the sheer joy of pouring small wooden cubes into a battle tower. I also love the very tight action planning- you can never do everything you want!
item.conditiontext: German edition, with English rules and cards printed and laminated. Shot glass for pouring cubes into tower included!

item.name: Werewolf
item.comment: I own a "Mafia" version of this game. Used to play it all the time in college. Great for VERY large groups of people at a party (12-20).

item.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game
